# Siemens Industrial Experience

> Siemens Industrial Experience

This file contains links to documentation sections following the llmstxt.org standard.

## Table of Contents

- [Breadcrumb - Usage](https://ix.siemens.io//docs/components/breadcrumb/guide.md): Breadcrumb navigation is a UI control that allows users to track their location within an application and easily navigate to previous or child pages.
- [Button - Usage](https://ix.siemens.io//docs/components/button/guide.md): Buttons initiate actions, apply actions to selected objects and activate/deactivate functions. We typically use buttons to trigger an immediate act...

- [Card list - Usage](https://ix.siemens.io//docs/components/card-list/guide.md): Card list content can be hidden or revealed by clicking on a control element. We typically use card lists on dashboards to show a huge amount of in...
- [Category filter - Usage](https://ix.siemens.io//docs/components/category-filter/guide.md): The category filter component enhances data navigation and user experience. We typically use a category filter to efficiently navigate large data s...
- [Checkbox - Usage](https://ix.siemens.io//docs/components/checkbox/guide.md): Checkboxes are commonly used when there are multiple options that can be selected or used to easily enable or disable a setting. They are often uti...
- [Chip - Usage](https://ix.siemens.io//docs/components/chip/guide.md): Chips typically contain a concise label and sometimes an icon, and they are both clickable and closable.

- [Overview](https://ix.siemens.io//docs/guidelines/accessibility/overview.md): We are committed that our deliverables qualify for building solutions that are accessible for everyone. We strive to meet **WCAG AA standards** by ...
- [Consistent](https://ix.siemens.io//docs/guidelines/cli/consistent.md): CLIs are the same across the whole product, follow our conventions and use our recommended frameworks.
- [Efficient](https://ix.siemens.io//docs/guidelines/cli/efficient.md): Commands are scannable, giving users just the right amount of information at the right time.
- [Getting started with CLI design](https://ix.siemens.io//docs/guidelines/cli/getting-started.md): This guide provides support for CLI creators at Siemens to offer consistent and clear commands that can be easily understood by our customers.
- [Helpful](https://ix.siemens.io//docs/guidelines/cli/helpful.md): CLIs support users by giving suggestions, being empathetic and providing error messages to move them forward.
- [Human](https://ix.siemens.io//docs/guidelines/cli/human.md): Design your commands for humans. Have a conversation. Speak the Siemens brand: Authentic, open and engaging.
- [Logical](https://ix.siemens.io//docs/guidelines/cli/logical.md): Commands guide users through tasks logically and intuitively to remove doubt.
- [Acknowledging users](https://ix.siemens.io//docs/guidelines/conversational-design/designing-conversations/acknowledging-users.md): In conversations, humans like to be acknowledged to shows the other person is listening and understands the situation. When a chatbot acknowledges ...

- [Confirming requests](https://ix.siemens.io//docs/guidelines/conversational-design/designing-conversations/confirming-request.md): Chatbots in industrial applications are sometimes required to carry out long-lasting and consequential changes to systems. Changing a system incorr...

- [Handing off users](https://ix.siemens.io//docs/guidelines/conversational-design/designing-conversations/handing-off-users.md): Chatbots must hand off their users whenever they’ve failed to clarify what the user wants or reach an accurate response. They should never continue...
- [Handling errors](https://ix.siemens.io//docs/guidelines/conversational-design/designing-conversations/handling-errors.md): When talking about chatbots and the mistakes they make, it’s always talked about handling them ‘gracefully’. However, in industrial situations, the...

- [System personas](https://ix.siemens.io//docs/guidelines/conversational-design/essentials/system-presonas.md): System personas refer to the personality of the chatbot. This includes its character, voice and how the chatbot responds and interacts with its users.
- [User intent](https://ix.siemens.io//docs/guidelines/conversational-design/essentials/user-intent.md): User intent refers to the main purpose or goal of users and is directly related to what they want to achieve – whether they’re trying to access inf...
- [Wording and terms](https://ix.siemens.io//docs/guidelines/conversational-design/essentials/wording-terms.md): Although AI chatbots are continuously evolving, many common words within the UI remain the same and have become the norm for agents and chatbots.
